meanings.definition: To cut or tear off the limbs of (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: The butcher had to dismember the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The forensic team had to dismember the body to gather evidence.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef managed to dismember the cake while trying to slice it.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to dismember the trees, leaving them scattered across the field.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie scene was so graphic that it showed how to dismember a zombie.

meanings.definition: To divide into parts or pieces
meanings.sent1: The puzzle was challenging to dismember into its individual pieces.
meanings.sent2: The project manager had to dismember the task into smaller steps for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his messy room seemed to dismember itself every time he left.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting seemed to dismember reality into colorful fragments.
meanings.sent5: The explosion caused the building to dismember into rubble in a matter of seconds.
